TopicTitle: What are you going to do the day KSP2 is released?

Articles.Content:
When KSP2 is finally released, I'll take the day off college (or work, if it gets delayed long enough), lock my door, grab $60, close the forum tab, close reviews, close all chrome tabs, download KSP2, and play for a few hours.

Then I'll probably hop on here and join in with everyone talking about how awesome it is. (Yeah I'm optimistic about the final game)

No plans.

I'll give it a couple of weeks (or months) because its bound to have a bunch of bugs and issues. Might wait for 2.1, might never get it anyway....
I will be working. But it would give me a chance to see if there is any show stopping bugs reported before I buy it.
I will go too the Mun for the 50th time!
I’m going to by it. Make a YouTube video about. Or not.
I already have a gigantic list of YT content. I will probably spend three days just not doing anything but KSP 2. I do have some major tests I am having plan for in 2022 tho

Voted 1 as that's the closest.

In reality though it will be buy and play as soon as I have time.   I doubt I will make special 'plans' or take time off.

1. Pre-order and preload the game (I have a slow connection)
  2. Take a couple of paid vacation days at work 
  3.  Go into radio silence mode, no forum, no articles, no reviews, only me and the game.
  4. Hours 0-2: Start a Sandbox, do a couple of suborbital flights, an orbital one and a fast Mun mission, just to test if the game is still Kerbal and worth Keeping
  5. Delete the save and start a Progression/Adventure/Career one if it passes the test, refund it (thanks Steam!) and wait a few weeks if it doesn't.

Assuming it's gonna launch on Friday, I'm probably gonna spend entire evening and most likely half of the night playing. And then most of Saturday. And Sunday. That's how it is with new games. Clocking a day of playtime in three days.
I'm going to see news of it's release, watch the inevitable 26 hours of IGN gameplay and review made less than 8 hours after release, then wait.
I dont not want KSP 2 to come out, but I prefer KSP 1 than 2. I'm not a fan of KSP2's GUI, and I feel like even though KSP will be the cool new game I think Im going to stay with KSP.
